name: Outer Shoals
economy_niches: shoreline and reef fisheries (net- and trap-fishing)
chartmaking, beacon upkeep, and pilotage fees
transshipment of imported ritual reagents and low-duty cargo
culture_adjustments: stronger risk-tolerance among crews; rites emphasize hazard appeasement
guild dominance concentrated in pilot and beacon fraternities
looser kin-clan ties on transient work fleets; more contract-based obligations
oral chart traditions elevated above written logs; ritualized nightly soundings
constraints: minimal arable land; food imports required
ritual magic dependent on imported reagents
strict guild licensing for pilotage and shipworks
notes: seasonal shoal charts updated by pilot guilds; charts are state-sensitive assets
beacon shrines combine Sea-Tide rites with practical lamp maintenance
saltworks and drying beds occupy most usable shore area
